dcterms:creator: J. Hannan
dcterms:description: The Hannan set is a foundational concept in game theory that represents the set of coarse correlated equilibria in repeated play, where players follow no-regret learning strategies.
dcterms:title: Hannan set

dcterms:creator: Y. Viossat
A. Zapechelnyuk
dcterms:description: The Viossat & Zapechelnyuk example illustrates a scenario in which players can have negative regret while consistently playing strictly dominated strategies, highlighting the limitations of no-regret dynamics.
dcterms:title: Viossat & Zapechelnyuk example

dcterms:creator: P. Coucheney
B. Gaujal
P. Mertikopoulos
dcterms:description: The Coucheney et al. dataset focuses on penalty-regulated dynamics in games, exploring robust learning procedures and their implications for strategic stability.
dcterms:title: Coucheney et al. (Penalty-regulated dynamics)

dcterms:creator: A. Giannou
E. Vlatakis-Gkaragkounis
P. Mertikopoulos
dcterms:description: The Giannou et al. dataset on 'Survival of the strictest' examines stable and unstable equilibria under regularized learning with partial information.
dcterms:title: Giannou et al. (Survival of the strictest)

dcterms:creator: A. Giannou
E. Vlatakis-Gkaragkounis
P. Mertikopoulos
dcterms:description: The Giannou et al. dataset on 'Convergence rate' investigates the convergence rates of regularized learning in games, addressing various feedback types and update structures.
dcterms:title: Giannou et al. (Convergence rate)
